vrt::PacketContainer

Detailed Description

Internal Use Only: Identifies a container for VRT packets that can be iterated over via ConstPacketIterator.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

vrt::PacketContainer::PacketContainer (  )  [inline]

Basic constructor for the class.

virtual vrt::PacketContainer::~PacketContainer (  )  [inline, virtual]

Basic destructor for the class.

Member Function Documentation

virtual ConstPacketIterator vrt::PacketContainer::begin (  )  const [pure virtual]

Gets an iterator over the packets in the container.

This is intended to be used similar to the following: 

    for (ConstPacketIterator pi = x.begin(); pi != x.end(); ++pi) {
      std::cout << "packet = " << (*pi) << std::endl;
    }

Implemented in vrt::AbstractVRAFile.

virtual ConstPacketIterator vrt::PacketContainer::end (  )  const [pure virtual]

Gets an iterator pointing to one position past the end of the packets in the container.

See begin for a usage example.

Implemented in vrt::AbstractVRAFile.

virtual BasicVRTPacket* vrt::PacketContainer::getThisPacket ( ConstPacketIterator &  pi,
bool  skip 
) const [pure virtual]

Internal Use Only: Called by the iterator to get the next packet beginning at the specified offset.

Parameters:
pi The packet iterator being used.
skip Skip over packet returning NULL, but update internal counters.
Returns:
The packet.
Exceptions:
NoSuchElementException If no such element exists.

Implemented in vrt::AbstractVRAFile.

virtual void vrt::PacketContainer::gotoNextPacket ( ConstPacketIterator &  pi  )  const [pure virtual]

Internal Use Only: Called by the iterator to determine if there is a next packet that begins at the specified offset.

Parameters:
pi The packet iterator being used.
Returns:
true if there is another packet beginning at the specified offset and false otherwise.

Implemented in vrt::AbstractVRAFile.
